block.p: Robin Suzanne Szalwinski, a daughter of Susan C. Long and Robert S. Szalwinski, both of Corpus Christi, Tex., is to be married today to Aitan Dror Goelman, a son of Marcella A. Goelman and Dr. Don Goelman of King of Prussia, Pa. Rabbi Yair Hillel Goelman, an uncle of the bridegroom, is to perform the ceremony at Congregation Tiferet Bet Israel in Blue Bell, Pa.

Mrs. Goelman, 27, is an occupational therapist at the Milestone School for Child Development, a private preschool in Brooklyn for children with disabilities. She is also a student at Dominican College in Orangeburg, N.Y. She received an associate's degree from St. Phillip's College in San Antonio. Her father is an electrical engineer in Corpus Christi for Southwestern Bell. Her mother owns and manages the A&A Realty Tax Service, a title search company in Corpus Christi. The bride is a stepdaughter of W. C. Long.

Robin Suzanne Szalwinski, a daughter of Susan C. Long and Robert S. Szalwinski, both of Corpus Christi, Tex., is to be married today to Aitan Dror Goelman, a son of Marcella A. Goelman and Dr. Don Goelman of King of Prussia, Pa. Rabbi Yair Hillel Goelman, an uncle of the bridegroom, is to perform the ceremony at Congregation Tiferet Bet Israel in Blue Bell, Pa.

Mrs. Goelman, 27, is an occupational therapist at the Milestone School for Child Development, a private preschool in Brooklyn for children with disabilities. She is also a student at Dominican College in Orangeburg, N.Y. She received an associate's degree from St. Phillip's College in San Antonio. Her father is an electrical engineer in Corpus Christi for Southwestern Bell. Her mother owns and manages the A&A Realty Tax Service, a title search company in Corpus Christi. The bride is a stepdaughter of W. C. Long.

Mr. Goelman, 32, is an assistant United States attorney in the violent gangs unit for the Southern District of New York, in Manhattan. He graduated from Michigan State University and received a law degree from Yale, where he was an editor of the law review. From 1995 to 1998, the bridegroom was a member of the team that prosecuted Timothy J. McVeigh and Terry Nichols, who were convicted of the 1995 Oklahoma City bombings. His mother is a learning specialist at Perelman Jewish Day School in Bala Cynwyd, Pa. His father is an associate professor of mathematics and the director of the graduate computer science program at Villanova.
